result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander G Hudson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To pay the costs of the action. (costs have been paid from cash bond posted)
Huber release and good time granted. 60 days to report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Alexander G Hudson in court with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State dismisses the domestic abuse enhancer, gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea.  Defendant stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 23, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Alexander G Hudson in court with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Nordin indicates matter is not resolved, asks that trial remain on the calendar. Court indicates this matter is in the #2 position for trial. Bond remains in effect.
from DA Pelrine asking to reschedule 5/23/16 jury trial as one of their witnesses is not available. Court reschedules.
Pre-trial conference on June 20, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Jury trial on June 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 05-24-2016 08:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 05-10-2016 09:45 am

Defendant Alexander G Hudson in court with attorney Megan Carollo.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Carollo indicates defendant is requesting a jury trial in this matter. Atty Carollo doesn't have Atty Nordin's calendar with her to schedule that trial. Court will have JA contact Atty Nordin when scheduling pretrial and trial. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Alexander G Hudson in court with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Nordin received discovery material from Atty Maciolek but did not receive the State's offer. Atty Nordin would like some time to get an offer from the State to try and resolve matter. State has no objection to adjournment. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Alexander G Hudson in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  No contact direct or indirect with C.B.  No violent contact with T.B.

Defendant Alexander G Hudson in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant requests time to retain an atty. State has no objection. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
